text: thousands of miles from the battlefields
of Iraq and Afghanistan another side of
America's fight against terror is
unfolding in this remote corner of West
Africa operation flintlock is part of
the new US Army Africa Command which
became operational just last month molly
is known as a peaceful country but some
sea warning signs on the horizon al
Qaeda and Islamic Maghreb is the threat
element located in the northern part of
Mali they use it as basically a base or
support base primarily northern Mali a
lawless sparsely inhabited area the size
of Texas is an ideal place for
extremists to take refuge and launch
activities into neighboring Algeria and
Mauritania Western countries want to
stop extremists from getting a toehold
in Mali as one of the world's poorest
countries Molly has only 10,000 military
and security forces and its army has
only two working helicopters and a few
airplanes to patrol the vast Saharan
North so army green berets and several
Dutch and German military instructors
are conducting training exercises to
teach soldiers and Molly skills in
marksmanship map reading and responding
under fire captain Youssef shower
reaction to ambush my future using the
helicopters and leadership skills
development like making the decision
like on a spot but the security risks
aren't only in northern Mali some
government and religious leaders say
there are some worries and trends inside
Molly's moss
with a huge population of unemployed
young men increasing influence from
conservative Wahhabi clerics from Saudi
Arabia and other Arab countries some
fear that a less tolerant form of Islam
is on the rise women who traditionally

found the prayer being given by an

because it's an Islam that has a
Cultural Foundation moly ins have

u.s. hopes that the combination of
